DOCNAME: CASE OF NOÉ, VAJNAI AND BAKO v. HUNGARY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 10 - Freedom of expression -{General} (Article 10-1 - Freedom of expression)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE and DATE and live in GPE and GPE respectively .

CARDINAL . At the material time , PERSON was Vice - President and PERSON and Mr Bakó were activists of ORG ) , a registered left - wing political party . The party had no known intention of participating in NORP political life in defiance of the rule of law .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants organised an event in front of a shopping mall in GPE , entitled “ NORP PERSON ” , with the intention to demonstrate against consumerism , draw attention to poverty , point out the shortcomings of market economy , and demand free internet access for all .

CARDINAL . To express their affiliation with Communism , QUANTITY persons , including the applicants , displayed a sheet and a flag with a CARDINAL - pointed red star and distributed leaflets with their political message , depicting red stars .

CARDINAL . In application of section CARDINAL/B(CARDINAL ) of LAW , a police patrol which was present called on the applicants to terminate the demonstration , checked their identity and committed them to GPE ORG for interrogation .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged a complaint with ORG against the police measures . They relied on the judgment of ORG adopted in the case of PERSON v. GPE ( no . DATE ) . They referred to the ORG ’s finding that the prosecution for having worn a red star had amounted to a violation of PERSON freedom of expression enshrined in LAW .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicants’ complaints were dismissed by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicants’ further complaints against the measures were dismissed by ORG on DATE . This decision was upheld by ORG , acting as a second - instance authority , on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the ORG requests for judicial review . The court held that the display of the red star contravened section CARDINAL/B of LAW , despite the PERSON judgment , whose application in the circumstances had been no task of the police officers present on the LOC . Consequently , the applicants’ identity check and committal to ORG was justified under sections CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) and CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of Act no . ORG of DATE on the Police .

CARDINAL . In review proceedings , ORG upheld ORG decision on DATE ( in the case of Mr Bakó ) , DATE ( in the case of PERSON ) , and DATE ( in the case of PERSON ) , endorsing in essence the first - instance NORP reasoning .
CARDINAL . The applicants , jointly ( they had a lawyer in common ) , incurred altogether QUANTITY in legal costs .
